q: Eric Schmidt , who oversaw Google's meteoric rise, told the DLD media conference in Munich on Tuesday. He told Reuters on January 21 that his move was an effort to speed up decision-making. In strategy we agree. There's no disagreement, Eric Schmidt said of his relationship with Larry Page , in a news conference following his DLD appearance. Gordon Brown 's office declined to comment, but Labour deputy leader Harriet Harman said police must investigate the allegations. Hacking into people's phones is illegal. Obviously the criminal law has got to be complied with and if it is broken then it should be investigated by the police and it should be enforced, she told Sky News. January 2011 10:01 AM I do love the pious attitude of the left on this subject, I remember a Tim Irelande when they were only to happy to jump into bed with Rupert Murdoch and the Sun! When Andy Coulson was editor of the NoW the paper purported to show George Osborne in a girls-and-cocaine situation, or so I have heard. Although this story was easily refuted, you would expect the future chancellor to be pretty miffed about it. And yet it is said that George Osborne himself suggested Andy Coulson as the Govt's director of communications. Amazing kind-heartedness on the part of a man not generally known for such qualities. the tape is Tommy Sheridan . Tommy Sheridan , who was defending himself, asked whether he was one of the "Wapping two top men" regarding the purchase of the tape. Mr Andy Coulson said: It came to Bob Bird first. He alerted me to its existence and I travelled to Glasgow. I viewed the tape and I suggested to Bob Bird he should do all he could to verify the tape, though I believed it to be authentic on my first viewing and the tape was published. mobile phones while he was editor of the News of the World. Insiders yesterday revealed that having to give evidence at the Tommy Sheridan trial was the tipping point for Andy Coulson . One source said: He was spending hours of his day trying to respond to stories about him. "He had to take a week off before Christmas to prepare and give evidence in the Tommy Sheridan trial and was then being filmed and photographed arriving and leaving the court. "He was right at the centre of the story instead of trying to manage it and he knew then that he had to go. Andy Coulson was the News of the World's editor in 2004, when the paper made allegations about Tommy Sheridan cheating on wife Gail. Tommy Sheridan questioned him in court about phone-tapping.
